result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Copy of minutes from BBH Hrg on 6/14/22 and bond form sent electronically to DCJ.

Cash bond is set in the amount of $300 (per case). $300 previously posted to apply. If the defendant posts cash bail, the defendant must report to and comply with Pretrial Services. The defendant shall report to Pretrial Services by 10:00 A.M. on the business day following his/her release from jail. The following checked category(s) are also ordered: _X_ GPS, __ Remote Breath (Alcohol) Monitoring, and/or __ Random Drug Testing. 
- Defendant shall not have any contact, direct or indirect, with Bianca B. 
- Defendant shall not have any contact with BMB.
- Defendant shall not be in the 1100 block of W Main Street in Sun Prairie, WI.
- Defendant shall be at residence at all times unless granted permission by DCPS for medical appointments, grocery shopping or employment interviews. 
NONCOMPLIANCE WILL BE REPORTED BY DCPS TO THE JUDICIARY WHO SHALL RESPOND IN ONE OF THESE WAYS: Schedule bail hearing, Increase Supervision, Issue warrant, No change but monitor.
